Based on your preferences for a docudrama movie, I would recommend "Syriana" as it is known for its political themes and is often considered one of the greatest films ever made.

Another option that you may find interesting could be "Find Me Guilty". This film tells the story of two influential figures in the criminal justice system: Senator Joe Tynan and Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Karen Traynor. The film explores their personal and professional lives, as well as the impact of their actions on others.

This classic science fiction film follows a man who decides to have his memories of his past life erased so he can start a new life as an astronaut named David "Robbie" Balfour. However, after he has had his memories erased, he finds himself on the run from his former employers in Rekall - a company that provides its clients with implanted fake memories of a life they would like to have led  - who are now convinced that he is actually their former employee, and are now attempting to recover the information that he possesses about the operations of their company.

Based on the provided preferences and genres, I would recommend 'The Odyssey'. This classic novel tells the story of Odysseus, King of Greece, who sets sail with his army from Troy in order to put an end to the Trojan War. After sailing for ten years, Odysseus finally reaches his home island, Ithaca, where he is welcomed by his loyal and faithful subjects.

This classic novel tells a timeless story about courage, perseverance, loyalty, and faith. It is a beautiful, touching, and inspiring story that every reader can find something meaningful, important, or helpful in it.

conversation.text: Based on your preferences, I recommend watching "Red." This action-packed film stars Bruce Willis as John Miller, a retired CIA agent who is recruited by his former partner, Mason "Ike" Carver (also played by Keanu Reeves), to track down and eliminate an international arms dealer. Alongside Willis, the film stars Morgan Freeman, who plays Rayburn, a private investigator hired by Carver to find out who's behind the arms dealer. The film also stars René Auberjonois, who plays Harry Callaway, the head of the CIA, and Peter Dinklage, who plays Jack Bauer, a highly skilled government agent.
